articles.title: Reddit Breach Highlights Limits of SMS-Based Authentication

articles.author: Christopher Alessi
articles.title: Oil prices deepen losses after surprise build in US inventories
articles.description: Crude oil futures slide even further, having fallen to their lowest level in almost six weeks in the prior session after fresh U.S> government data showed growth in petroleum stockpiles.

articles.author: Phoebe Cooke
articles.title: Woman sparks race row for calling cops on black woman sheltering in her doorway as she waited for an Uber
articles.description: A video of the incident has been shared nearly ten thousand times after the Facebook post prompted widespread outrage

articles.author: Sinéad Baker
articles.title: McDonald's served a pregnant woman a latte that was actually full of cleaning fluid
articles.description: Sarah Douglas, who is seven months pregnant, ordered a latte from a McDonald's drive-through in Lethbridge, a town in Alberta, Canada. After one sip of the drink, which looked the right color, she immediately realised it was full of chemicals, and spat it out…

articles.author: Mark Bergen, Shelly Banjo
articles.title: Google's Secret China Project Sparks Anger Among Workers
articles.description: Google staff awoke on Wednesday to surprising news: Their company is working on a search app tailored, and censored, for China. The project, kept secret from all but select teams and leaders, sparked a furious internal debate.

articles.author: Adam Shell
articles.title: Fidelity offers two index funds with zero fees, escalating a fight for customers
articles.description: Fidelity Investments says it will offer two index funds that track the U.S. and international stock markets with zero fees, the latest salvo in a price war.

articles.title: Ex-SEC Chair Mary Jo White Is One of Two Women Leading the Investigation of CBS CEO Les Moonves

articles.author: Trefor Moss
articles.title: Fiat Chrysler Has to Turn Jeep Around to Compete in China
articles.description: New Fiat Chrysler CEO Mike Manley once promised that China would be its global engine of growth. But the company’s first-half performance there was one of the weakest for any international auto maker.

articles.author: Susan Berfield, Craig Giammona, Leslie Patton
articles.title: Papa John's Founder Is at War With His Company
articles.description: The board is trying to stop the ex-CEO from mounting a comeback after a string of controversies.

articles.title: Tesla rally; Stocks slump on trade fears; CBS earnings
articles.description: Here's what you need to know about the markets before you start your business day.

articles.author: William Schomberg
articles.title: Bank of England poised to raise rates despite Brexit risk
articles.description: The Bank of England looks set to raise interest rates on Thursday to their highest level since the financial crisis almost a decade ago, defying warnings that it is taking a gamble while the terms of Brexit remain unclear.

articles.author: https://www.nytimes.com/by/sui-lee-wee
articles.title: Starbucks Partners With Alibaba, as It Tries to Keep Its Throne in China
articles.description: Once unrivaled in China, Starbucks now faces fierce competition. To combat that, it is teaming up with one of China’s biggest tech giants.

articles.author: Dana Hull
articles.title: Elon Musk Says Sorry, Starts Acting Like a Real CEO
articles.description: Elon Musk may have been on to something when he said Tesla Inc. was becoming a real car company. Just as importantly for investors, he’s acting more like a real CEO.

articles.author: Danielle Keeton-Olsen
articles.title: Ride-Hailing Startups Go-Jek & Grab Seek Success In Southeast Asia With Localization
articles.description: Southeast Asia's ride-hailing giants Grab and Go-Jek made recent moves to bring more customers online, and to do so, they're looking to local partners and teams to stand out amid the crowded market.

articles.author: Chris Sheldon | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
articles.title: Salads, wraps sold at Trader Joe's, Kroger, Walgreens may contain intestinal parasites
articles.description: The beef, pork and poultry salads and wraps were distributed by Caito Foods of Indianapolis and were shipped to distribution centers nationwide.

articles.author: Nick Timiraos
articles.title: Federal Reserve Holds Rates Steady, Says Economy Is Strong
articles.description: The Federal Reserve held short-term interest rates steady and offered an upbeat assessment of the economy’s performance, suggesting another interest-rate increase is likely at its next meeting.

articles.author: Sue Chang, Ryan Vlastelica
articles.title: US stocks close mostly lower as Fed stands pat; Apple buoys tech shares
articles.description: U.S. stocks close mostly lower Wednesday after the Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged but signaled another imminent rate increase. Fresh worries over U.S.-China trade friction dampened sentiment although positive results from Apple buoyed the tech …

articles.title: Pizza delivery guy asks to play family's piano, leaves everyone stunned
articles.description: An 18-year-old pizza deliveryman is going viral after wowing his customers with his piano skills. Bryce Dudal was delivering a Hungry Howie’s pepperoni pizza to the Varchetti family outside Detroit…
